title: Ayurvedic Sprouted Dal Mix (Protein Blend)
excerpt: Ready-to-cook sprouted legume mix (mung, moong, masoor) offering easier digestion and higher nutrient availability than dry dal.
content:
## What Is This Sprouted Dal Mix?
A balanced, ready-to-cook sprouted legume blend combining sprouted mung, moong, and masoor. Sprouting reduces anti-nutrients, improves digestibility, and enhances nutrient absorption compared with dry dals.

## Ayurvedic Significance
Sprouted legumes are lighter on digestion and align well with classical advice to favor easily digestible proteins—particularly for Vata and Kapha balancing when prepared warm with ghee.

### Key Benefits
- Higher bioavailability of nutrients.
- Gentle on digestion compared with unsprouted legumes.
- Good plant-protein source for daily meals.

## Ingredients
- Sprouted mung
- Sprouted moong
- Sprouted masoor
- Mild optional seasonings (cumin, turmeric) on request

## Usage Instructions
- Rinse and cook quickly (10–15 minutes) with water or light broth. Finish with a teaspoon of ghee for improved taste and assimilation.

## Packaging
- Chilled-section recommended for freshest texture; shelf-stable lightly dried option available for ambient storage.

## Safety & Consultation
- For those with advanced digestive disorders or legume intolerance, consult a practitioner. Rehydrate and cook thoroughly before consumption.

## Why Choose This Mix?
An easy, modern pantry staple that brings Ayurvedic thinking—light, warm preparation and mindful fats—into contemporary protein choices.
